changes: Added core functionality.

patches.description: Moved to a typescript code base and implemented an overlay.
changes: Refactored codebase to TypeScript.
Implemented overlay for better user experience.
Introduced Settings section to manage the overlay based on user preference
made the rotation details collapsable so it can be hidden when not being edited
Fixed minor bugs from previous version.
Optimisied the UI to reduce the lag.
Fixed bugs related to overlay rendering.
Updated the main header to be more unique to this app
Fixed a bug with saving rotation names being null
Introduced patch notes feature to keep users informed about updates.
Automatically view patch notes if the system detects a new version
Corrected a typo in the 2.1.0 changes.
Added a show patch notes button so that all patch notes can be viewed
Ordered patch notes in descending order so that newer versions come first
The add action button wasn't working, sorry! it's fixed now.

patches.description: Allow multiple rotations per set for easy cycling between phases
changes: Rotations are now saved in sets, the sets will contain one or many rotations! This means you can have a rotation for each phase of a boss, or just for convenience.
Added the ability to have multiple rotations per set.
Overlay now shows the selected rotation, and can cycle to the next rotation by pressing the main alt1 keybind (default is alt + 1).
Updated the UI to accommodate multiple rotations.
Moved the close button on this patch notes window to the top right corner so that it is more consistent with other windows.

patches.description: Patch - Fixed a bug with switching to old rotations
changes: Added functionality to enable users to switch to an older rotation set, which was saved in the old data format.
This isn't really much of a function change, but I have created a discord server for people to hop on and share rotations and feedback!
Added a button on the bottom of the settings section with a link to the discord server
Fixed a bug that was causing the overlays to flicker when using the Better Buff Bars addon at the same time.

patches.description: Better Rotation Notation! This is a major version increment so there may be bugs (hopefully not too many), if you do find any please feel free to come bother me on the discord about them.
changes: Introduce separator selector and notes input for each dropdown. This allows for more complex rotations to be created, such as those where you need to press 2 abilities at the same time!
Notes, added the ability to add a note to each ability which is shown in the overlay over the image
Seperator and notes are saved/loaded with rotations and shown in the preview, Default separator is '→', notes default to null

patches.description: Bug Fixes and Quality of Life Improvements
changes: Added 'tc' to the list of separators to allow for better notation of rotations that require a target cycle.
Added '↵'(new line) options to allow you to mark that you want a certain ability to be at the start of a line.
Resolved a bug with deleting rotations.
Added an edit rotation button. which opens a new popup. In this popup you can paste a rotation from PVME.
filter by Emoji names eg 'gconc'
